quiz.title: Economics: Elasticity, Revenue, Costs, and Production Law

questions.question: For an inferior good, the income elasticity of demand is:
questions.explanation: Inferior goods have a negative income elasticity—demand decreases as consumer income rises.

questions.question: The Average revenue curve is also known as the:
questions.explanation: Average revenue (AR) = total revenue / quantity sold = price per unit. Since price is determined by demand, the AR curve is the demand curve facing the firm.

questions.question: The variable cost of a firm varies in direct proportion to the:
questions.explanation: Variable costs (e.g., raw materials, labor for production) change directly with the level of output.

questions.question: Law of variable proportion is concerned with:
questions.explanation: The law of variable proportions (law of diminishing returns) analyzes how output changes when one variable input is increased while others are fixed—a short‑run phenomenon.
